Pre-Game Insights: USA seek support from American born and raised fans
USA's vice-captain Aaron Jones said ahead of the opening match: 'We've been speaking over the last couple of years about playing in World Cups, about taking USA cricket to higher heights.'
USA's vice-captain Aaron Jones emphasized that the team is determined to play a 'fearless' brand of cricket.
Canada's captain Saad bin Zafar believes his team are not under pressure and are equally excited to express themselves.
USA have had an upper hand over Canada in recent meetings and Canada's captain Saad bin Zafar wants his team to come out on top in the tournament opener.
Miscellaneous Highlights: USA host Canada in the opening match of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 in Dallas, Texas on Saturday, June 1.
The North American rivals have faced each other seven times in T20 matches, where USA have come on top on five occasions and Canada have won twice.
USA enter the T20 World Cup on the back of a stunning 2-1 series win over Bangladesh, who were packed with big names such as Shakib al-Hasan, Mustafizur Rahman and captain Najmul Hossain Shanto.
Canadaâ€™s last T20 outing was against USA in the five-match series that they lost 4-0 and will look to set things right.

USA squad: Monank Patel (captain), Shayan Jahangir, Andries Gous, Nitish Kumar, Steven Taylor, Harmeet Singh, Corey Anderson, Milind Kumar, Nisarg Patel, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Ali Khan, Jessy Singh, Saurabh Netravalkar, Nosthush Kenjige.

Canada squad: Saad bin Zafar (captain), Navneet Dhaliwal, Aaron Johnson, Ravinderpal Singh, Kanwarpal Tathgur, Shreyas Movva, Dilon Heyliger, Dilpreet Bajwa, Harsh Thaker, Jeremy Gordon, Junaid Siddiqui, Kaleem Sana, Nicholas Kirton, Pargat Singh, Rayyan Khan Pathan.
